> <OLD>
>
> The femme slowly went close to Stampy and while she cheked him she said "Who
> really are you?"

OOC: I am going to assume you meant Sharpedge since Stampy was
unharmed while Sharpedge had been blown into a wall.

<NEW>

SHARPEDGE looked as surprised as anyone else not to be dead or worse
having stood in front of GUILEDART. "We are part of Big Convoy's
team." he said in a low voice to NIGHTLIGHT.

NIGHTLIGHT may have heard about BIG CONVOY and his team, but it is
unlikely she ever met him. He was a combat mech, usually sent into the
most dangerous situations and his team's job was to fix it. He was
known as a Rough and tough, and he was a well known MAXIMAL who had an
expert team, but one that very few had met in person and fewer still
who knew him personally.

SHARPEDGE was shaking his head as he was helped into the room. "What
are you doing Guiledart?!?" He asked.

Taking a moment to manipulate controls on the panel in front of him
GUILEDART finally turned to regard SHARPEDGE. "I am helping you fool!"

"Why?!?" SHARPEDGE said, obviously not trusting GUILEDART.

"Because helling you helps Magmatron." He said in his deep tones.
"Something has happened to him, he is not acting like himself."

"And so you want us to take out your own commander?" SHARPEDGE said
incredulously.

GUILEDART grunted, "No. If you touch him I will be right behind you to
destroy you!"

"Then what do you want from us?" STAMPY said the white MAXIMAL finding
courage to speak.

There was a soft chuckle from GUIELDART, "I want you to take out
Saberback's machine." He said darkly. "I believe that is what is
causing all of this mess."

In an energy door opened, one that would transport them to their destination.

"And why should we do this for you?" SHARPEDGE said rising to his
feet, but still not quite raising his weapon against GUIELDART
although it was ready.

GUILEDART smiled wickedly, "Because if you don't the machine will
drain your world of its last defenses against Unicron and then call
him to finish the job." he pointed at the energy door, "Now go!"

(TAG)

- Preston
